Utterance: Hi! Welcome back. How has your week been?
Hi! It’s been a bit of a mixed bag, honestly.
I see. Last time, we set some goals for you. How did the mindfulness practice and bedtime routine go?
I tried the mindfulness in the morning a couple of times, and it was nice. The bedtime routine... well, I read once before bed, but I didn’t stick with it.
That’s okay! It’s a process. What do you think made it hard to stick to the bedtime routine?
I think I just got too tired and ended up falling asleep on the couch instead.
That’s understandable. It can be hard to change habits. Would you like to brainstorm some ways to make it easier to follow through with the bedtime routine?
Yeah, that would help.
One idea could be to set a reminder on your phone to start winding down at a certain time. Would that be something you’d consider?
That could work. I usually lose track of time when I’m watching TV.
Great! Let’s set that as a goal for this week. Now, how did you feel after practicing mindfulness?
I did feel calmer, but some days it was hard to focus.
That’s completely normal. Mindfulness is a skill that takes time to develop. Have you noticed any changes in your mood since starting those practices?
I think I’ve been a bit less irritable, but I still have my moments.
That’s progress! It’s important to acknowledge those small victories. What about your social outing? Did you reach out to a friend?
Yes! I met a friend for lunch, and it was really nice to catch up.
That’s wonderful! How did you feel during and after the lunch?
I felt really happy while we were talking, and afterward, I felt lighter again.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like social connections are really beneficial for you.
Definitely. I need to make that a priority.
Absolutely! Socializing can be a great way to combat feelings of sadness and isolation. Is there someone else you’d like to reach out to this week?
I might call another friend I haven’t talked to in a while.
That sounds like a great plan! Now, let’s talk about your feelings towards your ex-husband. Have you had any new thoughts or feelings about the situation?
I still feel angry, but I’m trying to remind myself that I can’t control his actions.
That’s a healthy perspective. Recognizing what you can and cannot control is an important part of healing.
Yeah, it’s just hard sometimes.
It is hard, especially when emotions are involved. Have you been able to express your anger in a healthy way?
I’ve tried talking to my friends about it, but I still bottle up a lot of it.
It’s good that you’re talking to friends. Another way to express anger could be through journaling or physical activity. Would you be interested in trying that?
I could try journaling. I used to do it a lot.
That’s a great idea! Writing can be a powerful outlet for emotions. How about setting aside some time to journal this week?
I can do that.

Excellent! Before we finish today, let’s summarize our goals for the upcoming week. You’ll try to establish a bedtime routine with reminders, practice mindfulness, reach out to another friend, and start journaling. Does that sound good?
Yes, that sounds very doable.
Fantastic! I’m looking forward to hearing how everything goes next time. Remember, it’s all about progress, and you’re doing great.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your help.
You’re very welcome! Take care of yourself, and I’ll see you next time.
Bye!
Bye!
